    BIDS conversion example with toy data BIDS conversion example with data from a tactile perception study (B006)

    Data from the Experiment B006

    B006Data.Rd

    These data are from an experiment on touch perception in humans that applied the so-called Limb Identification Task. In each trial, participants receive two stimuli that were either on the same arm or on two different arms and decided by lifting either their heels or toes whether they were on the same or on different limbs. Of interest is a limb crossing effect in this task, i.e., when the limbs are crossed, participants make mistakes and respond slowly despite the fact that the task does not require participants to take posture or spatial aspects into account in their decisions. For details see the publication under https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.02.01.578364.

    Usage

    B006Data

    Format

    A data frame with 32455 rows and 30 variables:

    Participant

    Participant identifier

    Run

    Experiment run (e.g., 'Run1', 'Run2')

    Posture

    Posture of the trial (e.g., 'uncrossed')

    StimSide

    Side of the stimulus (e.g., 'same', 'different')

    StimSegment

    Segment of the arm where the stimulus was applied

    Tactor1

    First tactor number

    Tactor2

    Second tactor number

    Tactor1Side

    Side of the first tactor (e.g., 'left', 'right')

    Tactor1Segment

    Segment of the arm for the first tactor

    Tactor2Side

    Side of the second tactor (e.g., 'left', 'right')

    Tactor2Segment

    Segment of the arm for the second tactor

    Stim1Intens

    Intensity of the first stimulus

    Stim2Intens

    Intensity of the second stimulus

    Trialtype

    Type of the trial

    SOA

    Stimulus Onset Asynchrony (interval between stimuli)

    Repetition

    Repetition count

    Trialnumber

    Number of the trial

    TimeAfterBeep

    Time after the beep (timing indicator)

    Response

    Participant's response

    Response_meaning

    Meaning of the response

    Response_correct

    Whether the response was correct

    RT

    Reaction time in milliseconds

    Order

    Order of the trial

    ResponseCoding

    Coding of the response

    Trial_ok

    Whether the trial was valid

    Trial_repeated

    Whether the trial was repeated

    Age

    Age of the participant

    Sex

    Sex of the participant (e.g., 'male', 'female', 'other')

    Arm_top

    The arm that was on top in the crossed condition

    Length_lower_arm

    Length of the participant's lower arm in centimeters

    Source

    Data collected in a behavioral neuroscience experiment at Tobias Heed's Reach and Touch Lab.
